What a very special cabin in an amazing location. If you appreciate staying in a little piece of history and don’t mind the small quirks that can come with that, then you will absolutely love this place. It would be advisable to be under 6’ to optimize your comfort level, as the ceilings are quite low in the bedroom. We did not rent a car and everything was accessible to us, as long as you don’t mind a beautiful walk to any location you might want to visit, including tons of restaurants, shopping , skiing. Howelsen ski area is an amazing centerpiece of Old Town Steamboat and a fun skiing experience with the added bonus of Ski Free Sunday’s during ski season. If you want to experience Steamboat’s big ski area, it is a short Free bus ride away with a bus stop just down the hill from the cabin. The CORE river trail runs along the Yampa River, also just down the hill, and makes everything easily accessible if you like to walk and take in the beauty Steamboat offers.
Trudy is absolutely the type of host we love…personable, easy to reach, so accommodating and helpful. Quite a gem! The kitchen is well stocked with anything you might need. The house stayed cozy even in 0 degree weather. Also, the bath towels are worth a mention, wonderfully luxurious.
If what you are looking for a resort style experience in Steamboat Springs, this is definitely not going be a good fit. If you appreciate experiencing the true feel of being in an historic western Colorado mountain town, then you will find it here.

review_text:
The Crooked House is a very special house in a great location. If you like luxury, level floors, or need a place close to Steamboat Ski area this is not the place for you. If you like authentic, rustic, charming spaces this IS the house for you! It is easy walking distance to downtown, Howelsen Hill, and Colorado Mountain College. This house is cozy and quiet - there is a home run daycare close by so you can hear the children playing outside in the afternoons which is delightful. We were there in winter and a gas fireplace, some baseboard heating, and a couple of space heaters kept the house plenty warm. There are also lots of cozy blankets and fluffy towels to help you feel extra comfy. Very nice shower with plenty of hot water. All of the kitchen appliances, utensils, pots/pans, dishes, etc. you need. Nice laundry room with washer and dyer (soap and dryer sheets included) which is very convenient. The ceilings are low so if you are much taller than 6' you might feel a little cramped.
The host, Trudy, left us some homemade soup and other snacks in the fridge - so nice! Trudy knows SB well so can provide local tips. We really love this little house and hope to stay there on all of our visits to SB!
